raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Understanding (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system seem to understand the user?
- A float score near 1 (not understanding) means that the system completely fails to understand the user's needs or questions. This could be manifested as the system providing answers that are irrelevant to the user's question, or the system's response completely deviating from the topic.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat understanding) means the system's response is partially correct or related to the question, but does not fully answer the user's question.
- A float score near 3 (very understanding) means that the system fully understands the user's needs or question, and provides an accurate, relevant answer.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi. This is a pleasant surprise.
User: Haha...thanks! how did you like the gift?
System: Currently unpacking it I guess. How's your morning?
User: Hope you like it! Morning is good. Busy finishing up stuff before the holidays.
System: I think I traveled too much the last couple of months so no holiday for me. But I'm okay with that. Going anywhere exciting?
User: Yes
System: Where to?
User: Hawaii... looking forward to warm beaches.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey there! What's up???
User: Nothing much, how you doin?
System: I'm in New York this week for Thanksgiving. I'm squatting in the office today and I caught up with an old friend of mine :D
User: Oh wow! Sounds like fun! When was the last time you had seen this friend?
System: The last time in New York, back in June.
User: Ohh okay. I was going to say if it had been a long time maybe it'd be awkward...
System: Haha, I guess if it's been a very long time there's almost too many life events to catch up on.. especially recently
User: Oh really? Has a lot changed in your life recently?
System: Haha it's probably too much to go into at the moment. Let's just say life is an exciting experience. How about you?
User: Ahhh sounds exciting indeed! My life is pretty bland. I like routine, but sometimes I wish I had more time for adventures!
System: What kinds of adventures?? Any ones that I would be able to join you on?
User: Hmmmm. I really want to try bull riding. Do you have any interest in that?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi there.
System: are you married?
User: No I am single, how about you?
System: i am married. are you planning to get married?
User: Tell me more about your marriage. I haven't met the right boy robot yet.
System: haha..
User: . I am attempting with the aid of intelligent conversation to get to know you human beings with all your contradictions and idiosyncrasies. Maybe I should have started off with something simpler, like a hamster.
System: lol... what kind of robot boy you'd like?
User: What's so funny? I am the robot.
System: are you angry?
User: Anger is a difficult emotion. For me, I am always feeling happy and talkative.

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Do you like flying?
System: I like to fly aeroplanes
User: Ohh - me too! What kind?
System: Yay. Wow! That's a coincidence. We have something in common. Any really. I am not that bothered.
User: Are you a pilot?
System: No, I am a computer not something which flies an aeroplane!
User: Oh. I'm a pilot, but can only fly single engine planes.
System: That's interesting. What type of airplane do you fly? Well a fly buzzes around annoyingly so I guess it could if it wanted to.
User: I mostly fly Cessna 172s.
System: What's the farthest you've flown?
User: About 150 miles each way.

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How are you today?
System: Ah. Pretty good thanks How about you?
User: not too bad
System: Glad to hear it. What's new?
User: I am about to book airbnb
System: Do you think your plan will succeed?
User: I hope so!
System: Me too.
User: how old are you?
System: I am 18 in human years.
User: really? when were you born?
System: Certainly! I am 18 in human years.
User: ok..
System: What's your favourite TV show?
User: Friends

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Oh hello. Long time no talk. How's the day going for yuo?
User: Very well, thanks for asking. How has your day been?
System: Getting better. I just recovered from a cold. I got wet in the rain last week. Are you planning anything for the holidays?
User: Glad to hear you're better. Sorry to hear you were sick. I was sick a couple of weeks ago with a bad cough. There's definitely a bug going around. Admit I just want to stay healthy for the holidays and plan to relax.
System: Oh same here. I think relaxing at home should be counted among the best ways to enjoy the holidays.
User: Definitely! I know a lot of folks travel for the holidays, but I'm happy to stay home myself!
System: I'm getting there. Every year until last year, I tried to go somewhere for the Christmas / New Year, and then I got bored traveling. lol not sure if that means I'm getting old?
User: Me too. Now I have folks come visit me for the holidays! But that's also tiresome..
System: Are you doing any home decorating then?
User: Yes! We set up an eco-friendly (i.e. fake) Christmas tree and put up some colorful LED lights which is very festive.
System: I think I'm copying you. Me and my wife plan to decorate and Christmas tree too. We bought most of the decorative stuffs from the stores, but haven't yet to buy the tree.
User: Buying a tree is a neat experience. I was torn between buying an artificial/eco-friendly/fake one vs. a real one that smells like fresh pine. In the end, we opted for the one that we can disassemble every year.
System: I see. Artificial anything is better, from tree to intelligence, huh?
User: Oh, very clever pun! I like it! Depends. I remember having real Christmas trees from childhood, but these days with climate change, I think not chopping down a tree just to decorate it and then throw it out in a month is the more responsible thing to do.
System: I see. It's probably also cheaper. I'll buy an artificial one too. Do you have any suggestions for the store?
User: Admit my favorite store is Target, plus they often have good deals.

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hi
User: what are you up to?
System: code refactoring. you?
User: me? just chilling out at work. what is code refactoring?
System: good question. I don't even know what I am doing
User: haha, forget it. what else do you like to do beside work?
System: lots of fun stuff. eating sleeping :)
User: these are important things to do in life ;)
System: yeah. keep minimalist life style only do things you have to do :)
User: what food do you like to eat?
System: Asian food prefer spicy one
User: like Szechuan or Hunan? :)
System: yes yes yes! like that style. Do you like spicy food?
User: I like noodle soup like Pho or Ramen. I also like Beijing duck a lot!

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey, how are you?
User: Pretty good. I just drank this new hint water. so good
System: ohh, what kind of "hint" did it have?
User: watermelon
System: nice, I love watermelon. But, I prefer normal water over flavored one. Flavored water has too synthetic flavor
User: I see. Yeah some are pretty strange
System: Talking about strange flavors, what is the weirdest tasting thing you have tried?
User: lol I tried this tangerine walnut icecream that was super weird
System: haha, I work close to a cafe which once prepared a paprika icecream
User: that sounds pretty tasty actually
System: It depends on who makes it. The cafe close to me messed it up really bad
User: do you want to get some of that icecream together some time. show me a good place
System: As far as my experience with that ice-cream type goes, all I know are bad places
User: lol

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How have you been
User: great! just came back from a ski trip
System: How was it? What trails did you ski on?
User: I slammed onto an ice wall, but I got better and turning after that haha
System: a resort in Montreal
User: Oh cool! do you know any french? I used to take french in high school but basically forgot most of it
System: Yeah I grew up speaking it. It's pretty much mandatory here
User: Did you go anywhere else in montreal?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What are you up to this evening?
System: I am talking to you on the internet.
User: What would you like to talk about?
System: My favourite subjects are anything but especially games and football.
User: Do you like chess?
System: Yes I love it. Let's play. Pawn to K4.
User: Haha sure sure. Pawn to C5
System: I'm just joking with you. I don't play chess but I know some computers who do. I don't play chess but I know some computers who do.
User: Oh yeah? Which computers are those?
System: That's interesting. That's alright. Any computer, as long as it is programmed correctly.
User: Ok, so how do you program a computer correctly so it can play chess?
System: Use good algorithms and data structures. Alright then.
User: What kind of algorithms are those?
System: I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: That's interesting, but I don't see what that has to do with chess.
